did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Hoover Institution Archives Photograph Card Catalog
did.abstract: The guide describes photographs separated from the paper materials of collections of personal or organizational papers organized by the archives until the practice of separating photographs from paper materials stopped in 1992. Paper materials for the collections may be described in a separate document under the same title.
did.langmaterial: Languages represented in the collection: English

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Each collection of photographs described in this list has its own collection title. Please use the following citation format, replacing "Collection Title" with the name of the collection used.
[Identification of item], Collection Title, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The guide describes photographs separated from the paper materials of collections of personal or organizational papers organized by the archives until the practice of separating photographs from paper materials stopped in 1992. Paper materials for the collections may be described in a separate document under the same title.
In order to view materials in the archives, please note the collection number and envelope or album letter code.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: The information contained in this document is reformatted directly from the photograph card catalog in the Hoover Institution Archives reading room. Paper materials for the collections may be described in a separate document under the same title.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: The photographs described in this document may have been separated from the paper materials of a collection of the same name. For more information on a particular collection, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

Young Men's Christian Association Collection

scopecontent.p: 20,000 photos of activities of the Y.M.C.A during World War I in the U.S. and Europe. Includes photos of military camps, hospitals, libraries, social and recreational activities, etc.
